description: Puppet type/provider for managing F5 device configuration.
name: puppetlabs-f5

properties.doc: F5 certificate resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The cerficate content in PEM format (sha1 fingerprint).
properties.name: content

parameters.doc:
The certificate management mode. An enumerated type that will
    describe what mode of key/cert management to use.  Values can match `/^MANAGEMENT_MODE_(DEFAULT|WEBSERVER|EM|IQUERY|IQUERY_BIG3D)$/`.
parameters.name: mode

providers.doc:
Manages f5 String classes (datagroups)

Default for `feature` == `posix`.
providers.name: f5_external_class

properties.doc: F5 External Class resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc:
The file format for the specified classes. This should only be called
    for external classes, since it does not make sense for non-external classes.  Values can match `/^FILE_FORMAT_(UNKNOWN|CSV)$/`.
properties.name: file_format

properties.doc:
The file modes for the specified classes. This should only be called
    for external classes, since it does not make sense for non-external classes.  Values can match `/^FILE_MODE_(UNKNOWN|TYPE_READ|TYPE_READ_WRITE)$/`.
properties.name: file_mode

properties.doc:
The file names for the specified classes. This should only be called
    for external classes, since it does not make sense for non-external classes.
properties.name: file_name

properties.doc: The class types for the specified classes.  Values can match `/^[[:punct:][:space:]]+$/`.
properties.name: data_separator

properties.doc: The class types for the specified classes.  Values can match `/^CLASS_TYPE_(UNDEFINED|ADDRESS|STRING|VALUE)$/`.
properties.name: type

providers.doc:
Manages f5 String classes (datagroups)

Default for `feature` == `posix`.
providers.name: f5_file

properties.doc: F5 file resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The file content.
properties.name: content

parameters.doc: The path to file on F5 device, must be absolute file path.
parameters.name: path

properties.doc: F5 key resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The cerficate key in PEM format (sha1 fingerprint).
properties.name: content

parameters.doc:
The key management mode. An enumerated type that will describe what
    mode of key/cert management to use.  Values can match `/^MANAGEMENT_MODE_(DEFAULT|WEBSERVER|EM|IQUERY|IQUERY_BIG3D)$/`.
parameters.name: mode

properties.doc: F5 monitor resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc:
The monitor templates' manual resume states. When enabled and a
    monitor has marked an object down, that object will not be marked up by the
    monitor, i.e. the object will be manually marked up.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: manual_resume_state

properties.doc:
The destination IP:port values for the specified templates. NOTE:
    This should only be done when the monitor templates in 'template_names'
    have NOT been associated to any node addresses or pool members.
properties.name: template_destination

properties.doc: The integer property values of the specified monitor templates.
properties.name: template_integer_property

properties.doc:
The monitor templates' enabled/disabled states. This will
    enable/disable all instances that use the specified templates. This serves
    as a quick and convenient method to enable/disable all instances, but if
    you want only to enable/disable a specific instance, use
    set_instance_enabled.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: template_state

properties.doc: The string property values of the specified monitor templates.
properties.name: template_string_property

properties.doc: The template types of the specified monitor templates.  Values can match `/^TTYPE_(UNSET|ICMP|TCP|TCP_ECHO|EXTERNAL|HTTP|HTTPS|NNTP|FTP|POP3|SMTP|MSSQL|GATEWAY|IMAP|RADIUS|LDAP|WMI|SNMP_DCA(|_BASE)|REAL_SERVER|UDP|NONE|ORACLE|SOAP|GATEWAY_ICMP|SIP|TCP_HALF_OPEN|SCRIPTED|WAP|RPC|SMB|SASP|MODULE_SCORE|FIREPASS|INBAND|RADIUS_ACCOUNTING|DIAMETER|VIRTUAL_LOCATION|MYSQL|POSTGRESQL)$/`.
properties.name: template_type

properties.doc: The monitor template transparent mode.  Valid values are `true`, `false`.
properties.name: template_transparent_mode

parameters.doc:
Determines if the specified monitor templates can be used directly,
    or a user-defined monitor based on each monitor must be created first
    before it can be used.
parameters.name: is_directly_usable

parameters.doc:
Determines if the specified monitor templates are read-only. The user
    can only modify properties for read/write monitor templates.
parameters.name: is_read_only

parameters.doc:
The parent monitor templates from which the specified monitor
    templates are derived. A user-defined monitor template will get its
    defaults from its parent monitor template.
parameters.name: parent_template

properties.doc: F5 node resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The connection limits for the specified node addresses.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: connection_limit

properties.doc: The dynamic ratios of a node addresses.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: dynamic_ratio

properties.doc: The ratios for the specified node addresses.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: ratio

properties.doc: The screen names for the specified node addresses.
properties.name: screen_name

properties.doc:
The states that allows new sessions to be established for the
    specified node addresses.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: session_enabled_state

parameters.doc: The node name. v9.0 API uses IP addresses, v11.0 API uses names.  Values can match `/^[[:alpha:][:digit:]\.]+$/`.
parameters.name: name

properties.doc: F5 pool resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The action to take when the node goes down for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^SERVICE_DOWN_ACTION_(NONE|RESET|DROP|RESELECT)$/`.
properties.name: action_on_service_down

properties.doc:
The states indicating whether NATs are allowed for the specified
    pool.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: allow_nat_state

properties.doc:
The states indicating whether SNATs are allowed for the specified
    pools.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: allow_snat_state

properties.doc: The IP ToS values for client traffic for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: client_ip_tos

properties.doc: The link QoS values for client traffic for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: client_link_qos

properties.doc: The gateway failsafe devices for the specified pools. (v11.0)
properties.name: gateway_failsafe_device

properties.doc: The gateway failsafe unit IDs for the specified pools. (v9.0)  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: gateway_failsafe_unit_id

properties.doc: The load balancing methods for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^LB_METHOD_(ROUND_ROBIN|RATIO_MEMBER|LEAST_CONNECTION_MEMBER|OBSERVED_MEMBER|PREDICTIVE_MEMBER|RATIO_NODE_ADDRESS|LEAST_CONNECTION_NODE_ADDRESS|FASTEST_NODE_ADDRESS|OBSERVED_NODE_ADDRESS|PREDICTIVE_NODE_ADDESS|DYNAMIC_RATIO|FASTEST_APP_RESPONSE|LEAST_SESSIONS|DYNAMIC_RATIO_MEMBER|L3_ADDR|UNKNOWN|WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTION_MEMBER|WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTION_NODE_ADDRESS|RATIO_SESSION|RATIO_LEAST_CONNECTION_MEMBER|RATIO_LEAST_CONNECTION_NODE_ADDRESS)$/`.
properties.name: lb_method

properties.doc: The list of pool members.
properties.name: member

properties.doc: The minimum active member counts for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: minimum_active_member

properties.doc:
The minimum member counts that are required to be UP for the
    specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: minimum_up_member

properties.doc:
The actions to be taken if the minimum number of members required to
    be UP for the specified pools is not met.
properties.name: minimum_up_member_action

properties.doc:
The states indicating that the feature that requires a minimum number
    of members to be UP is enabled/disabled for the specified pools.
properties.name: minimum_up_member_enabled_state

properties.doc:
The monitor associations for the specified pools, i.e. the monitor
    rules used by the pools. The pool monitor association should be specified
    as a hash consisting of the following keys:
    { 'monitor_templates' => [],
      'quorum' => '0',
      'type' => 'MONITOR_RULE_TYPE_AND_LIST' }
properties.name: monitor_association

properties.doc: The IP ToS values for server traffic for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: server_ip_tos

properties.doc: The link QoS values for server traffic for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: server_link_qos

properties.doc: The simple timeouts for the specified pools.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: simple_timeout

properties.doc:
The ramp-up time (in seconds) to gradually ramp up the load on newly
    added or freshly detected UP pool members.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: slow_ramp_time

providers.doc:
Manages f5 device clientssl profile

Default for `feature` == `posix`.
providers.name: f5_profileclientssl

properties.doc: Add or delete Client SSL profile.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc:
The certificate filenames to be used by BIG-IP acting as an SSL
    server.
properties.name: certificate_file

properties.doc:
The key filenames to be used by BIG-IP acting as an SSL server. If a
    full path is not specified, the file name is relative to
    /config/ssl/ssl.key.
properties.name: key_file

properties.doc: The CA to use to validate client certificates
properties.name: ca_file

properties.doc: The CA to use to validate client certificates
properties.name: client_certificate_ca_file

properties.doc: The peer certification modes for the specified client SSL profiles.
properties.name: peer_certification_mode

properties.doc: F5 profilepersistence resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc:
The states to indicate whether persistence entries added under this
    profile are available across pools. (v9.0)
properties.name: across_pool_state

properties.doc:
The states to indicate whether persistence entries added under this
    profile are available across services. (v9.0)
properties.name: across_service_state

properties.doc:
The states to indicate whether persistence entries added under this
    profile are available across virtuals. (v9.0)
properties.name: across_virtual_state

properties.doc:
The cookie expiration in seconds for the specified Persistence
    profiles. Applicable when peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_COOKIE.
    (v9.0)
properties.name: cookie_expiration

properties.doc:
The cookie hash lengths for the specified profiles. Applicable when
    peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_COOKIE, and cookie persistence method
    is COOKIE_PERSISTENCE_METHOD_HASH. (v9.0)
properties.name: cookie_hash_length

properties.doc:
The cookie hash offsets for the specified profiles. Applicable when
    peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_COOKIE, and cookie persistence method
    is COOKIE_PERSISTENCE_METHOD_HASH. (v9.0)
properties.name: cookie_hash_offset

properties.doc:
The cookie names for the specified Persistence profiles. Applicable
    when peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_COOKIE. (v9.0)
properties.name: cookie_name

properties.doc:
The cookie persistence methods to be used when in cookie persistence
    mode. Applicable when peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_COOKIE. (v9.0)
properties.name: cookie_persistence_method

properties.doc:
The names of the default profiles from which the specified profiles
    will derive default values for its attributes. (v9.0)
properties.name: default_profile

properties.doc: The descriptions for a set of persistence profiles. (v11.0)
properties.name: description

properties.doc:
the pattern marking the end of the section of payload data whose
    hashed value is used for the persistence value for a set of persistence
    profiles. This only returns useful values if the persistence mode is
    PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH and the hash method is PERSISTENCE_HASH_CARP.
      (v10.1)
properties.name: ending_hash_pattern

properties.doc:
The length of payload data whose hashed value is used for the
    persistence value for a set of persistence profiles. This only returns
    useful values if the persistence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH and the hash
    method is PERSISTENCE_HASH_CARP. (v10.1)
properties.name: hash_length

properties.doc:
The hash method used to generate the persistence values for a set of
    persistence profiles. This only returns useful values if the persistence
    mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH. (v10.1)
properties.name: hash_method

properties.doc:
The enabled state whether to perform another hash operation after the
    current hash operation completes for a set of persistence profiles. This
    only returns useful values if the persistence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH
    and the hash method is PERSISTENCE_HASH_CARP. (v10.1)
properties.name: hash_more_data_state

properties.doc:
The offset to the start of the payload data whose hashed value is
    used as the persistence value for a set of persistence profiles. This only
    returns useful values if the persistence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH and
    the hash method is PERSISTENCE_HASH_CARP. (v10.1)
properties.name: hash_offset

properties.doc:
The proxy map address used when map proxies state is enabled on
    source address persistence mode. (v11.0)
properties.name: map_proxy_address

properties.doc:
The proxy map IP address class/datagroup name used when map known
    proxies state is enabled on source address persistence mode. (v11.0)
properties.name: map_proxy_class

properties.doc:
The states to indicate whether to map known proxies when the
    persistence mode is source address affinity. (v9.0)
properties.name: map_proxy_state

properties.doc: The masks used in either simple or sticky persistence mode. (v9.0)
properties.name: mask

properties.doc:
The maximum size of the buffer used to hold the section of the
    payload data whose hashed value is used for the persistence value for a set
    of persistence values. This only returns useful values if the persistence
    mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH and the hash method is PERSISTENCE_HASH_CARP.
      (v10.1)
properties.name: maximum_hash_buffer_size

properties.doc: The mirror states for the specified Persistence profiles. (v9.0)
properties.name: mirror_state

properties.doc:
The states to indicate whether MS terminal services have been
    configured without a session directory for the specified Persistence
    profiles. (v9.0)
properties.name: msrdp_without_session_directory_state

properties.doc:
The state indicating, when enabled, that the pool member connection
    limits are not enforced for persisted clients. (v11.0)
properties.name: override_connection_limit_state

properties.doc: The persistence modes for the specified Persistence profiles. (v9.0)
properties.name: persistence_mode

properties.doc:
The UIE rules for the specified Persistence profiles. Applicable when
    peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_UIE. (v9.0)
properties.name: rule

properties.doc:
The sip_info headers for the specified Persistence profiles.
    Applicable when peristence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_SIP. (v9.4.2)
properties.name: sip_info

properties.doc: The pattern marking the start of the section of payload data whose hashed value is used for the persistence value for a set of persistence profiles. This only returns useful values if the persistence mode is PERSISTENCE_MODE_HASH and the hash method is PERSISTENCE_HASH_CARP. (v10.1)
properties.name: starting_hash_pattern

properties.doc:
The timeout for the specified Persistence profiles. The number of
    seconds to timeout a persistence entry. (v9.0)
properties.name: timeout

properties.doc: F5 rule resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The rule definition.
properties.name: definition

properties.doc: F5 snat resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The connection mirror states for a specified SNATs.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: connection_mirror_state

properties.doc:
The list of original client addresses used to filter the traffic to
    the SNATs.
properties.name: original_address

properties.doc: The source port behavior for the specified SNATs.  Values can match `/^SOURCE_PORT_(PRESERVE|PRESERVE_STRICT|CHANGE)$/`.
properties.name: source_port_behavior

properties.doc:
The translation targets for the specified SNATs. If the target type
    is SNAT_TYPE_AUTOMAP, then the translation object should be empty.
properties.name: translation_target

properties.doc:
The list of VLANs on which access to the specified SNATs is
    disabled/enabled.
properties.name: vlan

properties.doc: F5 snatpool resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The list of members belonging to the specified SNAT pools.
properties.name: member

properties.doc:
F5 snattranstlationaddress resource state. Valid values are present,
    absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The ARP states for the specified tranlation SNAT address.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: arp_state

properties.doc:
The connection limits of the specified original SNAT translation
    address.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: connection_limit

properties.doc: The state of a SNAT translation address.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: enabled_state

properties.doc: The IP idle timeouts of the specified SNAT translation address.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: ip_timeout

properties.doc: The TCP idle timeouts of the specified SNAT translation address.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: tcp_timeout

properties.doc: The UDP idle timeouts of the specified SNAT translation addresses.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: udp_timeout

properties.doc: The unit IDs for the specified tranlation SNAT address.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: unit_id

providers.doc:
Manages f5 String classes (datagroups)

Default for `feature` == `posix`.
providers.name: f5_string_class

properties.doc: F5 Sting Class resource state. Valid values are present, absent.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The string class members.
properties.name: members

properties.doc: Add or delete virtualserver.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The virtual server clone pool.
properties.name: clone_pool

properties.doc: The virtual server cmp enable state.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: cmp_enabled_state

properties.doc: The virtual server connection limit.  Values can match `/^\d+$/`.
properties.name: connection_limit

properties.doc: The virtual server connection limit.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: connection_mirror_state

properties.doc: The virtual server default pool name.
properties.name: default_pool_name

properties.doc: The virtual server destination virtual address and port.
properties.name: destination

properties.doc: The virtual server state.
properties.name: enabled_state

properties.doc: The virtual server fallback persistent profile.
properties.name: fallback_persistence_profile

properties.doc: The virtual server gtm score.
properties.name: gtm_score

properties.doc: The virtual server lasnat64 state.
properties.name: last_hop_pool

properties.doc: The virtual server nat64 state.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: nat64_state

properties.doc: The virtual server protocol.  Values can match `/^PROTOCOL_(ANY|IPV6|ROUTING|NONE|FRAGMENT|DSTOPTS|TCP|UDP|ICMP|ICMPV6|OSPF|SCTP)$/`.
properties.name: protocol

properties.doc: The virtual server rate class.
properties.name: rate_class

properties.doc: the virtual server persistence profiles.
properties.name: persistence_profile

properties.doc: the virtual server profiles.
properties.name: profile

properties.doc: The virtual server rules. The rule order isn't enforced since F5 API does not provide ability to reorder rules, use irule priority to dictate rule processing order
properties.name: rule

properties.doc: The virtual server snat type.  Values can match `/^SNAT_TYPE_(NONE|TRANSLATION_ADDRESS|SNATPOOL|AUTOMAP)$/`.
properties.name: snat_type

properties.doc: Virtual server snat_pool.
properties.name: snat_pool

properties.doc: The virtual server source port behavior.  Values can match `/^SOURCE_PORT_(PRESERVE|PRESERVE_STRICT|CHANGE)$/`.
properties.name: source_port_behavior

properties.doc: The virtual server translate address state.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: translate_address_state

properties.doc: The virtual server translate port state.  Values can match `/^STATE_(DISABLED|ENABLED)$/`.
properties.name: translate_port_state

properties.doc: The virtual server type.  Values can match `/^RESOURCE_TYPE_(POOL|IP_FORWARDING|L2_FORWARDING|REJECT|FAST_L4|FAST_HTTP|STATELESS)$/`.
properties.name: type

properties.doc: The virtual server vlan.
properties.name: vlan

properties.doc: The virtual server wildmask.
properties.name: wildmask

author: puppetlabs
